Key Match Events: Brenton Doyle made a diving catch on the warning track early in the second inning.
Doyle left the game in the fifth inning due to pain in his left hand.
Sam Hilliard replaced Doyle and hit a solo home run off Brewers reliever Jared Koenig in the eighth inning.
Ty Blach surrendered back-to-back home runs to Willy Adames and Gary Sánchez in the first inning.
William Contreras hit a two-run homer off Blach in the third inning.
Ryan McMahon hit a lead-off homer in the fourth inning off Tobias Myers.
Joey Ortiz hit a run-scoring double in the fourth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Bud Black praised Doyle's defensive skills and his game-ending throw from the previous night.
Post-Match Reflections: Brenton Doyle expressed that he does not expect his injury to keep him out of the lineup for long.
Manager Bud Black reflected on Doyle's defensive plays and his potential for a solid career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Reliever Jaden Hill made his Major League debut, pitching a scoreless inning.
